title: Stop grouping Emails, waiting for a fix
content: I am still waiting fr a fix to this problem, emails are grouped in the inbox and the option to set them as un-grouped does not exist
creator: carl4849

title: Am receiving incoming emails but am unable to read them.
content:
After listing incoming emails the following message is displayed: " The account ******.net.au is being processed. Please wait until processing is complete. But it never completes! A steady blue line appears on the right side of the bottom line while on the bottom line on the left is the message 'No emails to download".

Another message encountered: Sending of password for user ******@******..com did not succeed. Mail server mail6.hosting platform.com responded Maximum number of connections from user+lp exceeds (mail.max userip.connections=3)

Finally to close Thunderbird by pressing pressing the "X" in the top right corner doesn't work - have to shut down the computer.

I'm thinking the best solution may be to reinstall Thunderbird provided existing emails will not be lost, and help will be appreciated.
creator: MurfOscar

title: can't log into account
content:
I can't send or receive emails since Telstra changed the authentication. three different technicians from Telstra have given me three different addresses for incoming mail none of which work. At least with pop address it comes up with message below:

Login to server pop.telstra.com with username xxxxxxx@bigpond.com failed.

With an incoming stmp or imap address I don't get any response at all.

How do I fix this? Thanking you in advance Desperate
creator: gyfbvss4jy

title: Thunderbird Tasks
content: I would like to make a text list of all future tasks and events for a specific period of time, for instance all of 2026. Can I do this in Thunderbird?
creator: eckkyy

title: Cannot write new mails in mailfolder
content:
Every time I want to fetch new mails, I have an Warning saying:

Error in account (my account) Could not write mail in mailfolder. Ensure that You have writing rights to the filesystem, and You have sufficient disk space to copy the mailfolder.

I have app 1,2 Mb mails on my system in mailfolders. I have 375 Gb free disk space. I have full rights to the filesystem and have tried to start Thunderbird with administrator rights.

I am running Thunderbird 128.0.1esr (64-bit)
creator: ansbaek

title: tb 115.13.0 creates new folders by itself that cannot be deleted
content:
My TB has created 2 INBOX subfolders named "archive" and "archives" by itself and they cannot be deleted. (location: imap://XXX@mail.XXXX.com/INBOX/Archive (XXX=PII redacted and location: imap://XXX@mail.XXXX.com/INBOX/Archives (XXX=PII redacted) TB also created a subfolder "Outbox" to Local Folders, (location: mailbox:///C:/Users/XXX/AppData/Roaming/Thunderbird/Profiles/k0qhfwl3.default/Mail/Local Folders/Unsent Messages)

I even closed TB, went to the folder location and deleted the file - and they just came back.
creator: j856979

title: Unable to forward or send emails
content: On attempting to forward or even send emails, I get the following pop up message on trying to send. Some years ago I had an Outlook email address on Thunderbird but removed it. At that time, sending or forwarding emails wasn't affected and wasn't until recently.I still receive emails ok. The message is as follows: 'Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: This email was not sent but there is a way to fix it. To resend successfully you need to update your email settings (e.g. Outlook) to turn SMTP authentication on. For guidance on how to do this please visit: https://www.telstra.com.au/support/email/unauthenticated-traffic-limit Reference: OB315 e{9f3c547a-93d4-4f7f-9f1d-14b2a88679e7}. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again.' I can't really understand the message. Can someone help me out with this issue? Yours etc, Richard
creator: RIDOCK

title: imap inbox is showing up in unified inbox
content: I just added an email address which is set up using IMAP. I have another email address which is set up as IMAP; the rest are POP3. For some reason, the inbox of this IMAP account is showing up in the unified inbox and not in the same area as another IMAP email address. Can someone help me to move this IMAP inbox away from the unified inbox?
creator: vetboy

title: layout of message list on inbox has changed
content: I just updated to the latest version of Thunderbird (128.0). My layout is set to vertical view. The layout on the list of messages (the middle section in between the list of folders and the message preview pane) looks very different from the previous version. The font is smaller and each message pane seems to take up more space (less dense). I wish I could describe the problem better by sending a screenshot, but I only know to do that in Firefox, not Thunderbird. I've tried to adjust the settings (either adjusting the density or zoom) but I can't get it to look the same as before. Adjusting the font size bigger makes each message take up more space so fewer messages fit in the message list. Can someone help?
creator: vetboy

title: Invio posta PEC - Risulta indirizzo non corretto nella dicitura PER CONTO DI
content:
Salve, quando invio delle PEC mi compare un indirizzo scorretto nella dicitura PER CONTO DI. A seguito di verifica nei log della PEC inviata sul sito di Aruba PEC non risulta l'indirizzo che si rileva dalla ricevuta di invio che si allega.

Per eventuale contratto telefonico: 0172 43 14 60

Grazie
creator: perforadrill

title: Can You Somehow Merge a Sub-Folder from Folder A with a Same-name Sub-Folder in Folder B?
content:
I'm helping my 80 year old father with quite a mess with his email.

He's been using Outlook for about 40 years, and back in 2021, his email service provider, Telus here in Canada, switched their email service over to Google Gmail, and long story short, the switchover from Telus' in-house email service to a Telus-branded Google email service ended up causing a real mess with my Dad's email, due to his main laptop's Outlook desktop application getting switched from IMAP to POP, whereas his Microsoft Surface remained Outlook IMAP, for the past 3.5 years, so they got totally out of sync from each other in some very complicated ways for which there seems no simple fix.

I offer that background just to perhaps explain what I'm about to ask.

In Thunderbird, if there is:

1) a Folder named "Alpha" with a bunch of Sub-Folders

2) a Folder named "Alpha New" with a bunch of Sub-Folders, many of which have the same names of the Sub-Folders within "Alpha" but many of the Sub-Folders having totally different names

and you want to amalgamate the Sub-Folders in the Folder "Alpha" with the Sub-Folders in the Folder "Alpha New,"

and for example you have:

1) a Sub-Folder named "Beta" within the Folder "Alpha"

2) a Sub-Folder named "Beta" within the Folder "Alpha New"

so you to drag "Beta" Sub-Folder from the Folder "Alpha" to the Folder "Alpha New,"

then what will happen?

I ask because in Gmail, it will present a dialogue saying you cannot do that because there is already a Label named "Beta" nested within the Label "Alpha New."

Will Thunderbird give a similar warning, or will it ask if you want to merge the two folders or something?
creator: rob.brownridge
